plants.name: Cymbidium
plants.description: Cymbidium orchids are popular ornamental plants known for their elegant and long-lasting flowers. They bloom in autumn and early winter, producing spikes of beautifully shaped flowers that can be white, pink, green, or yellow.
plants.location: Asia, cultivated globally in temperate climates
plants.funFact: Cymbidium orchids can thrive in cooler temperatures compared to many tropical orchids, making them favorites for autumn bloom in temperate regions.

plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: Chrysanthemums, often called mums, are classic autumn-flowering garden plants. They have dense flower heads in various forms and colors. They are symbols of autumn in many cultures and bloom abundantly in fall months.
plants.location: East Asia origin, widely cultivated worldwide
plants.funFact: In Japan, chrysanthemums symbolize the imperial family and are celebrated in the annual Festival of Happiness.

plants.name: Lonicera sempervirens
plants.description: A native honeysuckle species that produces tubular, trumpet-shaped flowers attracting hummingbirds. It blooms in late summer through fall, offering bright red and orange flowers in temperate zones.
plants.funFact: Trumpet honeysuckle is a favorite nectar source for migrating hummingbirds during their fall journey.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: An Australian native tree species known for its distinctive, large cylindrical flower spikes rich in nectar. It flowers in spring through autumn, including October, providing food for birds and insects.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in some areas, mainly August to October
plants.funFact: Banksia flowers arenâ€™t single flowers but dense clusters of tiny individual flowers packed together.
